hypothesis_content.title: Structural Shift Timing: Low-Liquidity Reversal at Key Technical Levels
hypothesis_content.statement: In current NEUTRAL regime with reduced liquidity, tests of major support/resistance levels (previous weekly high/low) produce false breakouts 65%+ of the time, with reversions averaging 2.8% within 8 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Thin order books exaggerate breakouts that lack fundamental conviction. Market makers unable to provide sufficient liquidity at technical levels create 'stop hunts' that reverse when larger participants fade the move. The October liquidity crash amplified this effect.
entry_conditions: BTC tests within 0.3% of previous weekly high or low
Aggregate order book depth at level < 70% of 30-day average for that level
Initial breakout volume < 85% of 20-day average volume
RSI(4) on 15min chart > 85 (for resistance) or < 15 (for support)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Sustained breakout >1.5% beyond level with increasing volume

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakouts become valid >65% of the time at key levels, indicating either 1) liquidity has recovered, or 2) directional conviction overcomes structural limitations.
